Judul: PENINGKATAN KUALITAS PEMBELAJARAN MATA KULIAH PEMROGRAMAN BERORIENTASI OBJEK
Abstrak:
At Informatics Engineering department of Ã‚Â’XÃ‚Â’s university, Object Oriented Programming (PBO), is a basic 

compulsory subject that support several courses in the following semester. The results of learning process 

evaluation of OOP at the end of the even semester 2009-2010 showed that the percentage of students who did 

not pass in this course is still high, about 40%. Some of the causes identified were learning motivation and 

learning participation outside the class are still low, the motivation to often learn practice programming are 

low, difficulty to imagine how a program running and to understand the change value of the variables, the 

students did not know the relationship between teaching materials with real life clearly, and distribution of 

students' understanding was unfair. A number of innovations had been implemented in the odd semester 

2010/2011 to improve the quality of the learning process. The innovation can be grouped into five categories, 

namely the curriculum development and course content organization, delivery methods and techniques, 

innovative learning media to support self-learning, classroom management, and learning assessment. The 

results of evaluation at the end of odd semester 2010-2011 showed an increase in GPA average, from 1879 to 

1.9896 and the percentage of pass students from 60.16% to 62.5%. Based on the satisfaction questionnaire, it is 

known that the level of satisfaction of students were above 3.5 of 5. So it can be concluded that the innovation 

can improve the quality of the learning process. But, as educators, we must always try to make improvements.
